name: Ext.Config
doc:
This class manages a config property. Instances of this type are created and cached as classes declare their config properties. One instance of this class is created per config property name.

 Ext.define('MyClass', {
     config: {
         foo: 42
     }
 });

This uses the cached Ext.Config instance for the "foo" property.

When config properties apply options to config properties a prototype chained object is created from the cached instance. For example:

 Ext.define('MyClass', {
     config: {
         foo: {
             $value: 42,
             lazy: true
         }
     }
 });

This creates a prototype chain to the cached "foo" instance of Ext.Config and applies the lazy option to that new instance. This chained instance is then kept by the Ext.Configurator for that class.

members.name: cached
members.doc: When set as true the config property will be stored on the class prototype once the first instance has had a chance to process the default value.
members.short_doc:
When set as true the config property will be stored on the class prototype once
the first instance has had a chance t...

members.name: lazy
members.doc: When set as true the config property will not be immediately initialized during the initConfig call.
members.short_doc:
When set as true the config property will not be immediately initialized during
the initConfig call. ...

members.name: merge
members.doc: This function if supplied will be called as classes or instances provide values that need to be combined with inherited values. The function should return the value that will be the config value. Further calls may receive such returned values as oldValue.

properties.name: newValue
properties.doc: The new value to merge with the old.

properties.name: oldValue
properties.doc: The current value prior to newValue being merged.

properties.name: target
properties.doc: The class or instance to which the merged config value will be applied.

properties.name: mixinClass
properties.doc: The mixin providing the newValue or null if the newValue is not being provided by a mixin.

members.short_doc:
This function if supplied will be called as classes or instances provide values
that need to be combined with inherit...

members.name: names
members.doc: This object holds the cached names used to lookup properties or methods for this config property. The properties of this object are explained in the context of an example property named "foo".

properties.name: initializing
properties.doc: The property that is true when the config is being initialized ("isFooInitializing").

members.short_doc:
This object holds the cached names used to lookup properties or methods for this
config property. ...

members.name: getInternalName
members.doc: Returns the name of the property that stores this config on the given instance or class prototype.
members.short_doc:
Returns the name of the property that stores this config on the given instance or
class prototype. ...

members.name: mergeSets
members.doc:
Merges the newValue and the oldValue assuming that these are basically objects the represent sets. For example something like:

 {
     foo: true,
     bar: true
 }

The merge process converts arrays like the following into the above:

 [ 'foo', 'bar' ]
members.short_doc:
Merges the newValue and the oldValue assuming that these are basically objects
the represent sets. ...
